summary: In Asian mythology, Nagas are magical creatures with a human body and a snake's tail. They live in a place called Patala and can sometimes look like humans or snakes. Female Nagas are called Nagini. People have worshipped them in South Asia for over 2,000 years. They are important in Hindu and Buddhist stories and art. The king of the Nagas is known as Nagaraja. Some people even say they are their ancestors!
title: Nāga
